Question:
ALW-001 - Which of the following documents have to be on board for an international flight?
a) Certificate of aircraft registration
b) Certificate of airworthiness
c) Airworthiness review certificate
d) EASA Form-1
e) Airplane logbook
f) Appropriate papers for every crew member
g) Technical logbook
ALW-002 - Which area could be crossed with certain restrictions?
ALW-003 - Where can the type of restriction for a restricted airspace be found?
ALW-004 - What is the status of the rules and procedures created by the EASA? (e.g. Part-SFCL, Part-MED)
Correct: They are part of the EU regulation and legally binding to all EU member states

Question: ALW-005 - What is the validity of the "Certificate of Airworthiness"?
ALW-006 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "ARC"?
ALW-007 - The "Certificate of Airworthiness" is issued by the state...
Correct: in which the aircraft is registered.

Question: ALW-008 - A pilot license issued in accordance with ICAO Annex 1 is valid in...
ALW-009 - What is the subject of ICAO Annex 1?
ALW-010 - What is the period of validity of a private pilot license (PPL)?
ALW-011 - What is the minimum age to obtain a private pilot license?
ALW-012 - What are the minimum requirements among others to acquire a rating for VFR night flights?
Correct: At least 5 additional flight hours at night, three of them with a flight instructor with at least 1 hour cross-country flight plus 5 solo take-offs and full-stop landings

Question: ALW-013 - The validity of a medical examination certificate class 2 for a 62 years old pilot is...
ALW-014 - In which way is a SEP (land) rating renewed if you do not meet the required flight time?
Correct: A proficiency check with an examiner

Question: ALW-015 - The possession of a european PPL(A) entitles the holder to...
Correct: act as PIC on non-commercial flights without compensation as well as to receive compensation as a flight instrucor.

Question: ALW-016 - What is the minimum age to start a private pilot training at a flight school?
ALW-017 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "SERA"?
Correct: Standardized European Rules of the Air

Question: ALW-018 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "TRA"?
ALW-019 - What has to be considered when entering an RMZ?
Correct: To permanently monitor the radio and if possible to establish radio contact

Question: ALW-020 - What condition has to be met during a Special VFR flight?
ALW-021 - What has to be done before entering a TMZ?
Correct: Switch on the transponder and activate mode A and C or mode S

Question: ALW-022 - What is the meaning of an area marked as "TMZ"?
ALW-023 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "IFR"?
ALW-024 - A flight is called a "visual flight", if the...
Correct: flight is conducted under visual flight rules.

Question: ALW-025 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "VMC"?
ALW-026 - Two engine-driven aircraft are flying on crossing courses at the same altitude. Which one has to divert?
Correct: Both have to divert to the right

Question: ALW-027 - Two aeroplanes are flying on crossing tracks. Which one has to divert?
Correct: The aircraft which flies from right to left has the right of priority

Question: ALW-028 - In airspace "D" a Boeing 737 and a Cessna 152 are flying on crossing courses. Which aeroplane has to divert?
Correct: The aeroplane flying from right to left has priority, the other one has to divert

Question: ALW-029 - Which of the following options is NOT a sufficient reason to fly below the required minimum height?
Correct: Bad weather conditions in the vicinity of an aerodrome

Question: ALW-030 - A single-engine piston and a turboprop aeroplane are approaching each other opposite at the same altitude. Which aeroplane has to change its track to avoid a collision?
Correct: Both aircraft have to alter their tracks to the right

Question: ALW-031 - Which distances to clouds have to be maintained during a VFR flight in airpaces C, D and E?
ALW-032 - The minimum flight visibility at 5000 ft MSL in airspace B for VFR flights is...
ALW-033 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "C" for an aircraft operating under VFR at 5000 ft MSL?
ALW-034 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "E" for an aircraft operating under VFR at FL75?
ALW-035 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "C" for an aircraft operating under VFR at FL110?
ALW-036 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "C" for an aircraft operating under VFR at FL125?
ALW-037 - What are the minimum distances to clouds for a VFR flight in airspace "B"?
ALW-038 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "C" below FL 100 for an aircraft operating under VFR?
ALW-039 - What is the minimum flight visibility in airspace "C" at and above FL 100 for an aircraft operating under VFR?
ALW-040 - The term "ceiling" is defined as the...
Correct: height of the base of the lowest layer of clouds covering more than half of the sky below 20000 ft.

Question: ALW-041 - Being intercepted by a military aircraft at daytime, what is the meaning of the following signal: Alternating movement of the ailerons, normally left of the intercepted aircraft, followed by a smooth turn to the left?

ALW-042 - Being intercepted by a military aircraft at daytime, what is the meaning of the following signal: A sudden heading change of 90 degrees or more and a pull-up of the aircraft without crossing the track of the intercepted aircraft?
ALW-043 - The altimeter is switched from local QNH to 1013.25 hPa...
Correct: when climbing above the transition altitude.

Question: ALW-044 - During a flight at FL 80, the altimeter setting has to be...
ALW-045 - What is the purpose of the semi-circular rule?
Correct: To avoid collisions by reducing the probability of opposing traffic at the same altitude

Question: ALW-046 - Which of the following options are possible SSR-Transponder modes?
ALW-047 - A transponder with the ability to send the current pressure level is a...
ALW-048 - Which transponder code indicates a loss of radio communication?
ALW-049 - Which transponder code should be set during a radio failure without any request?
ALW-050 - Which transponder code has to be set unrequested during an emergency?
ALW-051 - Which air traffic service is responsible for the safe conduct of flights?
ALW-052 - Air traffic control service is conducted by which services?
Correct: TWR (aerodrome control service) APP (approach control service) ACC (area control service)

Question: ALW-053 - Which answer is correct with regard to separation in airspace "E"?
Correct: VFR traffic is not separated from any other traffic

Question: ALW-054 - Which air traffic services can be expected within an FIR (flight information region)?
ALW-055 - A pilot can contact FIS (flight information service)...
ALW-056 - What is the correct phrase with respect to wake turbulence to indicate that a light aircraft is following an aircraft of a higher wake turbulence category?
ALW-057 - Which of the following options states a correct position report?
ALW-058 - What is the meaning of the abbreviation "AIREP"?
ALW-059 - What information is provided in the general part (GEN) of the AIP?
Correct: Map icons, list of radio nav aids, time for sunrise and sunset, airport fees, air traffic control fees

Question: ALW-060 - What are the different parts of the Aeronautical Information Publication (AIP)?
ALW-061 - What information is provided in the part "AD" of the AIP?
Correct: Table of content, classification of airfields with corresponding maps, approach charts, taxi charts

Question: ALW-062 - The shown NOTAM is valid until... A1024/13 A) LOWW B) 1305211200 C) 1305211400 E) STOCKERAU VOR STO 113.00 UNSERVICEABLE.
ALW-063 - A Pre-Flight Information Bulletin (PIB) is a presentation of current...
Correct: NOTAM information of operational significance prepared prior to flight.

Question: ALW-064 - The term "aerodrome elevation" is defined as...
Correct: the highest point of the landing area.

Question: ALW-065 - The term "runway" is defined as a...
Correct: rectangular area on a land aerodrome prepared for the landing and take-off of aircraft.

Question: ALW-066 - Which statement is correct with regard to the term "taxi holding point"?
Correct: A taxi holding point is the point at which the aircraft must stop unless further permission to proceed is given

Question: ALW-067 - What does the reported runway condition "WET" mean?
Correct: The surface of the runway is soaked, but there are no significant patches of standing water

Question: ALW-068 - What does the reported runway condition "DAMP" mean?
Correct: Change of colour on the surface due to moisture

Question: ALW-069 - What does "WATER PATCHES" mean regarding the reported runway condition?
Correct: Patches of standing water are visible

Question: ALW-070 - How can a wind direction indicator be marked for better visibility?
Correct: The wind direction indicator could be surrounded by a white circle.

Question: ALW-071 - What is the meaning of a flashing red light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft in flight?
ALW-072 - What is the meaning of a flashing green light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft in flight?
Correct: Return for landing, followed by steady green at the appropriate time

Question: ALW-073 - What is the meaning of a steady green light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft in flight?
ALW-074 - What is the meaning of a flashing white light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft on ground?
ALW-075 - What is the meaning of a flashing red light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft on ground?
Correct: Immediately taxi clear of runway in use

Question: ALW-076 - What is the meaning of a flashing green light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft on ground?
ALW-077 - Of what shape is a landing direction indicator?
ALW-078 - What is the purpose of the signal square at an aerodrome?
Correct: It contains special symbols to indicate the conditions at the aerodrome visually to over-flying aircraft

Question: ALW-079 - In which way should a pilot confirm received light signals in flight?
ALW-080 - What is the meaning of a steady red light signal at a controlled aerodrome directed to an aircraft on ground?
ALW-081 - How are two parallel runways designated?
Correct: The left runway gets the suffix "L", the right runway "R"

Question: ALW-082 - According to ICAO Annex 14, which is the colour marking of a runway?
ALW-083 - What is indicated by a pattern of longitudinal stripes of uniform dimensions disposed symmetrically about the centerline of a runway?
Correct: Do not touch down before them

Question: ALW-084 - Which runway designators are correct for 2 parallel runways?
ALW-085 - What is a "PAPI" (Precision Approach Path Indicator)?
Correct: A visual aid that provides guidance information to help a pilot acquire and maintain the correct glidepath to an aerodrome or an airport

Question: ALW-086 - An aerodrome beacon (ABN) is a...
Correct: rotating beacon installed at an airport or aerodrome to indicate its location to aircraft pilots from the air.

Question: ALW-087 - Which is the colour of runway edge lights?
ALW-088 - Which is the colour of runway end lights?
ALW-089 - What is shown on the printed sign? See figure (ALW-019)
ALW-090 - What is shown on the printed sign? See figure (ALW-020)
Correct: From this intersection the available runway length is 2500 m in the stated direction

Question: ALW-091 - What is the meaning of this sign at an aerodrome? See figure (ALW-011)
ALW-092 - What is the meaning of the illustrated ground signal as shown in the signal area of an aerodrome? See figure (ALW-012)
Correct: After take-off and before landing all turns have to be made to the right

Question: ALW-093 - What is the meaning of "DETRESFA"?
ALW-094 - Who provides search and rescue service?
ALW-095 - How can a pilot confirm a search and rescue signal on ground in flight?
ALW-096 - With respect to aircraft accident and incident investigation, what are the three categories regarding aircraft occurrences?
ALW-097 - What is the primary purpose of an aircraft accident investigation?
Correct: To identify the reasons and work out safety recommendations
